page.title: 07Rickleton and Picktree.
page.content: Anju Meisuria with children from Ayton Primary School surveyed the villages of{Rickleton and Picktree:- We first noticed{a club,and a chapel which opened on 30th August l975. We crossed the road and saw some{council {houses and flats.}There were three shops,two for{newspapers and one take- {away.}We saw a little{park}then crossed the road again to{Rickleton {School.}It has 340 children and a nursery class.Ours will have 200 children when it is full but it only has 86 at the moment.We walked through New Vigo Wood to some{architect- {designed houses,}one had two sheds and a swimming pool.They had big gardens. The only old places were{Picktree {cottages and farm.}People who lived in the cottages would have worked on the farm but it is now dilapidated. The cottages are still occupied.
